title: Food Journaling: Awareness Changes Behavior
description: A 60-second lesson on Food Journaling: Awareness Changes Behavior.

hook.text: People who write down what they eat lose twice as much weight as those who don't â€” even eating the same foods.

buildup.text: A Kaiser Permanente study of 1,700 people found food journaling was the single strongest predictor of weight loss.

discovery.text: The act of recording forces awareness. Most people underestimate their intake by 40% without a journal.

twist.text: It's not about counting calories â€” even a simple photo of each meal creates enough awareness to change behavior.

climax.text: The journal effect works because it inserts a decision point where autopilot previously ruled.

punchline.text: You don't need a diet plan. You need a mirror for your eating.

quiz.question: Why is food journaling effective for behavior change?
options: It creates awareness and a decision point
